__e: Do you know, Inspector, I spend half my life talking to the scum of the earth, and I pride myself that I never get angry.
To clean the trash can of society, I've chosen to become more than a man.
I address you as soldiers. Although you're still just the crap of society.
I don't like people threatening me, especially scum like you.
Where I come from, we have a name for scum like you.
No, killing's too good for scum like you.
Don't ever count me with you and your scum!
No, killing's too good for scum like you.
Where I come from, we have a name for scum like you.
These are just scumbags nobody cares about.
I don't know, uh, all the talk about... how you wouldn't have to put up with the scum of the Earth anymore.
Your friend, the one who told you about your poor mother, when the scamp who took you from home would not.
I know for a fact that you're out there on the street and you're rubbing shoulders with scum, and I can only imagine how much money you've taken and not vouchered.
She doesn't know that most of them are scum and that when you get one who is faithful and good to you and your mother that you keep him!
You think the man's scum. I agree... and prayed on her entire political career! But have you had a look at this room tonight?
I ain't no white trash piece of shit.
They would stick you with the white trash. They don't work all day.
Well, Dad said to Mom that you were just like white trash.
Well, I guess I could sit down and let you make me some breakfast.
How does someone like you sleep at night? With all the scum you represent?
